sources.title: Boiling Point (1932) HOOT GIBSON
sources.description:
Stars: Hoot Gibson, Helen Foster, Wheeler Oakman

Directors: George Melford

TRIVIA: A pioneering cowboy star of silent films, Hoot Gibson (1892-1962) ranked second only to Tom Mix in box-office draw. He made the successful transition to “talkies” but when singing cowboys became the new rage,  Gibson was regulated to B-westerns and by the 1950s, he faced financial ruin.

metadata.Plot: Jimmy's uncle gives him 30 days probation on Kirk's ranch to control his temper or lose his inheritance. There he gets tangled up with a gang of robbers whose boss is his rival for Kirk's daughter. With one day left in his probation, they goad him into a fight.
metadata.Actors: Hoot Gibson, Helen Foster, Wheeler Oakman
